results.title: Metformin alleviates hyperkalemia-induced arrhythmia and cardiac injury in mice through decreasing SK2 and intracellular Ca<sup>2</sup>.
results.text_hl: The potential protective role of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ on acute @<m>DISEASE_Hyperkalemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006947 @@@hyperkalemia@@@ remains unclear.

results.title: Natural Oil and Polycystic Ovary Syndrome: A Comprehensive Review of Therapeutic Benefits.
results.text_hl: A variety of conventional treatments, including @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, oral contraceptives, and anti-androgen agents, have been used to treat @DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@PCOS@@@ and its complications, but they have been linked to several negative side effects, including @<m>DISEASE_Hyperkalemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006947 @@@hyperkalemia@@@, @DISEASE_Weight_Gain @DISEASE_MESH:D015430 @@@weight gain@@@, @DISEASE_Chemical_and_Drug_Induced_Liver_Injury @DISEASE_MESH:D056486 @@@cardiovascular and hepatic toxicity@@@, @CHEMICAL_Vitamin_B_12 @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014805 @@@vitamin B12@@@ and @DISEASE_Folic_Acid_Deficiency @DISEASE_MESH:D005494 @@@folic acid@@@ deficiency.

citations.NLM: Kumari P, Barbhuiya PA, Warjri I, Pathak MP. Natural Oil and Polycystic Ovary Syndrome: A Comprehensive Review of Therapeutic Benefits. Curr Top Med Chem. 2025 Aug 5;():. PMID: 40770474
citations.BibTeX: @article{40770474, title={Natural Oil and Polycystic Ovary Syndrome: A Comprehensive Review of Therapeutic Benefits.}, author={Kumari P and Barbhuiya PA and Warjri I and Pathak MP}, journal={Curr Top Med Chem}}

results.title: [Lactic acidosis and severe hyperkalemia in a diabetic patient treated with metformin and enalapril: influence of acute renal disease and drugs].
results.text_hl: [@DISEASE_Acidosis_Lactic @DISEASE_MESH:D000140 @@@Lactic acidosis@@@ and severe @<m>DISEASE_Hyperkalemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006947 @@@hyperkalemia@@@ in a @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetic@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Enalapril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004656 @@@enalapril@@@: influence of @DISEASE_Acute_Kidney_Injury @DISEASE_MESH:D058186 @@@acute renal disease@@@ and drugs].

results.title: Metformin-induced lactic acidosis and acute pancreatitis precipitated by diuretic, celecoxib, and candesartan-associated acute kidney dysfunction.
results.text_hl: We report the case of a 50-year-old @SPECIES_9606 @@@woman@@@ who was prescribed 11 drugs, including a diuretic, @CHEMICAL_Celecoxib @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068579 @@@celecoxib@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, and @CHEMICAL_candesartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:C081643 @@@candesartan@@@, and who developed @DISEASE_Acute_Kidney_Injury @DISEASE_MESH:D058186 @@@acute kidney dysfunction@@@ while on these drugs, manifesting as severe @DISEASE_Proteinuria @DISEASE_MESH:D011507 @@@proteinuria@@@, acute @DISEASE_Azotemia @DISEASE_MESH:D053099 @@@azotemia@@@, @<m>DISEASE_Hyperkalemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006947 @@@hyperkalemia@@@.

citations.NLM: Audia P, Feinfeld DA, Dubrow A, Winchester JF. Metformin-induced lactic acidosis and acute pancreatitis precipitated by diuretic, celecoxib, and candesartan-associated acute kidney dysfunction. Clin Toxicol (Phila). 2008 Feb;46(2):164-6. PMID: 18259965
